metadata.name: Something to Live For
metadata.description:
"Her face was veiled; yet to my fancied sight
Love, sweetness, goodness, in her person shined
So clear as in no face with more delight.
But O, as to embrace me she inclined,
I waked, she fled, and day brought back my night."



The Ivory Tower consists of a story series of solitude. The solitary figures have scars on their bodies which are the marks of previous existences. The darkness of the forest full of eerie spirits of other worlds is their safe haven which they fled to endure much longer. Ultimately, the stories of Ivory Tower are unsettlingly depictions of the irrationality of the life.

2022
Digital Drawing
2500x3000px
